intro: Stackhousia spathulata f. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stackhousia, is a botanical variant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, with a distinctive glossy appearance. This form is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
